'''Usplash''' is a [[software]] project started by [[Ubuntu Linux]] to replace the starting text scroll screens that appear while booting a Linux-based computer with a graphical [[splash screen]]. It was designed to replace [[bootsplash]], which did the same thing but in the [[kernel]] level. Usplash being in userspace instead allows it to be updated without recompiling the kernel.
+
'''Usplash''' is a [[software]] project started by [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] to replace the starting text scroll screens that appear while booting a Linux-based computer with a graphical [[splash screen]]. It was designed to replace [[bootsplash]], which did the same thing but in the [[kernel]] level. Usplash being in userspace instead allows it to be updated without recompiling the kernel.
Usplash uses the [[Linux framebuffer]] interface, or alternatively direct [[VESA]] access to display the splash screen.
Usplash uses the [[Linux framebuffer]] interface, or alternatively direct [[VESA]] access to display the splash screen.
